column3: It’s a phenomenal piece of public art at the entrance to the Chiat-Day block that in fact it is known colloquially as the Binoculars Building.Unsurprisingly Frank Gehry was the architect and completion was in the early 2000s. Entrance to the car park and for pedestrians is between the lenses.

This is an interesting building that you see by walking down Main St (need to be on the south side to see the full thing). All of the building seems to have gotten a fresh coat of black paint so it’s looking particularly weird now.

We did the typical drive up, get out, snap snap snap and drive off. I did get back in the car first, he didn't drive off without me.It's a pretty impressive piece.I love big roadside attractions and this one is pretty cool!
A very peculiar building that used to house the advertising agency TBWA\Chiat\Day. Meanwhile the agency moved on but the building still is one of its kind!

We've always loved the "distinctly Frank" architecture of the Chiat-Day since it was first built, and still enjoy driving by or walking by during the annual Venice Art Walk. Most catching is the Claes Oldenburg huge binoculars - they are a Wow factor. We walked around the outside as there are no interior tours. Enjoy the sight! ...
